thread.title: TV tonight: 'Big Bang Theory,' 'Minority Report'

title: TV tonight: 'Big Bang Theory,' 'Minority Report'
text:
USA TODAY's Robert Bianco previews the television lineup for October 5, 2015. Former 'Forever' star Alana de la Garza guest stars in 'Scorpion'. VPC
Keith Carradine returns as Penny's father on "The Big Bang Theory." (Photo: Monty Brinton, CBS)
3 CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE The Big Bang Theory
CBS, 8 ET/PT
First, let's salute Bang for moving quickly to put the Mandy/Leonard/Penny triangle story behind it. (Well, assuming Penny and Leonard's recommitment to their marriage is the end of the story; you never can be certain with sitcoms.) Then be happy it's bringing back Keith Carradine — one of those actors who just seems to brighten most every project he joins — as Penny's father, who is about to learn that his daughter eloped. Luckily for Leonard, he's off to Mexico for a belated bachelor party.
USA TODAY
Critic's Corner chat: Mon., 2 p.m. ET
Scorpion
CBS, 9 ET/PT
In the mixed-news category, many fans of Forever were unhappy when ABC decided not to renew that fantasy series starring Ioan Gruffudd and Alana De La Garza — but its cancellation did free up De La Garza for a recurring role as Scorpion's new, more supportive head of Homeland Security. The character and the actor are welcome additions, but you might not want to get too used to either one: De La Garza is also scheduled to be a regular on the upcoming Criminal Minds spinoff.
Dash (Stark Sands) and Detective Vega (Meagan Good) in the "Hawk-Eye" episode of "Minority Report." (Photo: Fox)
Minority Report
Fox, 9 ET/PT
Report 's second outing doubled down on the grim quotient and added an extra dash of incoherence. Let's see if it can start moving in a more positive direction tonight, as Vega tries to find Dash a job at the police department.
